TopicTitle: Do you have a screenshot that makes you laugh every time?

Articles.Content:
Looking back over my past pics (of which I have far too many), I realise that the whole experience has basically been one long gag-reel. This is one of my favourite ones, resulted from a docking+robotics related glitch which totally deformed one of the robots, while the other one looks on with concern;

[![zbrMBYkh.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/zbrMBYkh.jpg)](http://imgur.com/zbrMBYk)

And from more recently, this one cracks me up because of the scale, that's actually a fair sized craft

[![Yafd7f0l.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/Yafd7f0l.jpg)](http://imgur.com/Yafd7f0)

(Who needs a heat shield when you've got a Class E to hide behind!?)

![ZHb2Iao.png](http://i.imgur.com/ZHb2Iao.png)

Jool reflected in Val's visor.
> ![JIhyaiq.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/JIhyaiq.jpg)

0.90 good times

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/tOV79)

Took a new one today.. D4002 was steaming head long for the yard when I failed to notice the bump that I usually go around or approach slowly.. no brake bug in effect.. 

D4002 and her train became airborne and had an unplanned train wash 

![7bXHLn5.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/7bXHLn5.jpg)
![zxmiuxF.png](http://i.imgur.com/zxmiuxF.png)

A somewhat old pic, back from 0.25, but nonetheless, teaches an important lesson.

[![WGsvLvQ.png](http://i.imgur.com/WGsvLvQ.png)](http://imgur.com/WGsvLvQ)

Don't let Mechjeb drive.

Also, this isn't a screenshot, and it wasn't made by me (actually cannot remember who made it), but it still cracks me up:

[![p4XlPtx.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/p4XlPtx.jpg)](http://imgur.com/p4XlPtx)

***Bob what are you doing in the service bay again!?***

![ee9mdp3.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/ee9mdp3.jpg)

I can't decide which is better. They both make me laugh.

![RqQFGVG.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/RqQFGVG.jpg)

![5Mx0mNM.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/5Mx0mNM.jpg)

> 
> I can't decide which is better. They both make me laugh.
> [http://i.imgur.com/RqQFGVG.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/RqQFGVG.jpg)
> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/5Mx0mNM.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/5Mx0mNM.jpg)

Ladies and Gentlemen, we have a winner!

I've "accidentally" put a drill through a Kerbal before, but that pic, with just the one eye poking out, that's brilliant.

And that 2nd pic, I can't even...I have no words, my words have failed me.

> 
> Take mission to rescue Kerbal stranded in LKO. Find this.
> [http://i.imgur.com/dOPpASKh.png](http://i.imgur.com/dOPpASKh.png)
> 
> I shall not even ask how a truck cabin ended up in LKO.

Because the truck cabin is treated as a command module (that's from SXT, right?) and the contract generator in Career will use any of those.

I once had Take Command installed, and played Career--and had to rescue a command chair. No Kerbal sitting on it either.

No, the game put the Kerbal *inside*Ã¢â‚¬â€¹ the chair.

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZleLqACdEGE?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
.
![dxpc2L7.png](http://i.imgur.com/dxpc2L7.png)

I have another I could share but I'm saving it for Halloween. ![:0.0:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_shocked.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-28T19:55:33Z" title="06/28/2015 07:55  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 28, 2015</time> by LitaAlto**

Some more pics of mine, this time from the journey of the KSS Points Pirate (used in the "Mun Landing Endeavour" challenge)

After firing the satellite "cannon" launching 32 satellites at once.

![3PYndzB.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/3PYndzB.jpg)

Ejecting the eight mini rovers.

![cqcFLgn.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/cqcFLgn.jpg)

A Kerbal using his head literally, to right one of the mini rovers that had fallen over, by jamming underneath its driver and jumping.

![A7moJCy.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/A7moJCy.jpg)

The tiniest Mun Grand Prix.

![61e2dgQ.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/61e2dgQ.jpg)

The whole "mission" was an exercise in exploiting the challenge's points system, so it was way more fun than serious. So here's the album.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/hTyA2)

I was testing a bomb bay made out of ProceduralFairings and Infernal Robotics parts and decided to put my Kerbal in it. He fell towards the gap between the two panels and got stuck in a hilarious way:

![FbKUPyl.png](http://i.imgur.com/FbKUPyl.png)
